title: Ticket #6634: condor_q -global does not reset column widths when switching schedds
description:
condor_q -global for non-batch mode output (-hold for instance) does not adjust column widths individually for each schedd it talks to. In particular this can result in truncated cluster and/or proc id's if the first schedd has a smaller maximum cluster id than the other schedds.

This fragment of output shows the bug 

root@ldas-grid ~]# condor_q -hold -global -allusers
> ...
> - Schedd: ldas-pcdev1.ligo.caltech.edu : <10.14.0.18:9618?... @ 11/28/17 13:22:35
> ID          OWNER          HELD_SINCE  HOLD_REASON
> 96765165.0   xxxxxxxxxxxxxx 11/13 04:49 MemoryUsage 2198 MB > RequestMemory 204
> 96765975.0   xxxxxxxxxxxxxx 11/13 04:49 MemoryUsage 4151 MB > RequestMemory 409
> 1028064260   yyyyyyyyyyy    11/4  20:16 via condor_hold (by user yyyyyyyyyyy)
> 1028064270   yyyyyyyyyyy    11/4  20:16 via condor_hold (by user yyyyyyyyyyy)
> 1028064330   yyyyyyyyyyy    11/4  20:16 via condor_hold (by user yyyyyyyyyyy)
> 1028064370   yyyyyyyyyyy    11/4  20:16 via condor_hold (by user yyyyyyyyyyy)
>

I believe that the bug is in fnFixupWidthCallback which will only adjust the width if it is currently 4 for the cluster id column or 3 for the procid column. But the underlying data structure being adjusted is shared across schedds in global mode.
